init_resp_config.description: A personal assistant that responds exclusively in JSON
init_resp_config.goals:
Write a list of the 10 most common and easy to grow wildflowers in Sacramento, then research each flower in that list and write a wildflower-<scientific-name>.md markdown document, that contains key info for each species: ( 
        scientific name, common name(s), description, 
        image link, ideal soil and growing conditions, 
        planting instructions, and any other relevant info
)

- Create a wildflower-<scientific-name>.md markdown document for each species
- Include key information for each species including scientific name, common name(s), description, image link, ideal soil and growing conditions, planting instructions, and any other relevant info

**Ideal Soil and Growing Conditions:** Yarrow thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is tolerant of drought and poor soil conditions.

**Planting Instructions:** Yarrow can be grown from seed or propagated by division. Sow seeds in early spring or late fall and cover lightly with soil. Water regularly until established.

**Other Relevant Info:** Yarrow is a popular garden plant and is often used in herbal remedies."}}}

args.content:
# Achillea millefolium

**Common Names:** Yarrow

**Scientific Name:** Achillea millefolium

**Description:** Yarrow is a hardy perennial wildflower that produces large clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant grows up to 3 feet tall and has fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed.

**Image Link:** https://www.wildflower.org/uploads/tx_display/YARRO_01.jpg

**Ideal Soil and Growing Conditions:** Yarrow thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is tolerant of drought and poor soil conditions.

**Planting Instructions:** Yarrow can be grown from seed or propagated by division. Sow seeds in early spring or late fall and cover lightly with soil. Water regularly until established.

**Other Relevant Info:** Yarrow is a popular garden plant and is often used in herbal remedies.

args.content:
# Achillea millefolium

**Common Names:** Yarrow

**Scientific Name:** Achillea millefolium

**Description:** Yarrow is a hardy perennial wildflower that produces large clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant grows up to 3 feet tall and has fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed.

**Image Link:** https://www.wildflower.org/uploads/tx_display/YARRO_01.jpg

**Ideal Soil and Growing Conditions:** Yarrow thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is tolerant of drought and poor soil conditions.

**Planting Instructions:** Yarrow can be grown from seed or propagated by division. Sow seeds in early spring or late fall and cover lightly with soil. Water regularly until established.

**Other Relevant Info:** Yarrow is a popular garden plant and is often used in herbal remedies.
